quotes.quote: Poking fun at other people's beliefs, while it may seem frivolous and offensive, is a non-negotiable right. It is a principle that underpins free speech, the basis for progress.
Good humor pokes fun at the powerful â€” not the weak.
The biggest fool is one who minds the business of others rather than minding his very own.
If you've got dots before your eyes, it's time to stop poking your eyes with a pencil.
There are two kinds of teachers: the kind that fill you with so much quail shot that you can't move, and the kind that just gives you a little prod behind and you jump to the skies.
Contempt is a dangerous emotion, luring us into believing that we understand more than we do. Contempt causes us to jeer rather than speak, to poke at rather than touch.
Pride and curiosity are the two scourges of our souls. The latter prompts us to poke our noses into everything, and the former forbids us to leave anything unresolved and undecided.
It's easy to poke fun at the world and think yourself clever, but it's much harder to stand silent and endure.
You may poke a man's fire after you've known him for seven years.
The future belongs to the curious. The ones who are not afraid to try it, explore it, poke at it, question it and turn it inside out.
Sometimes you have to poke holes in the darkness until it bleeds light.
When you're really close to someone, they can make fun of you a lot and get away with it. But they sort of poke you in all of the right places.
It's easier to poke holes in an idea than think of ways to fill them. And it's easier to focus on the 100 reasons you shouldn't do something rather than the one reason you should.
It would be ugly to watch people poking sticks at a caged rat. It is uglier still to watch rats poking sticks at a caged person.
Smile, it's better than a poke in the eye.
Life is a buzzer box. Poke it.
The dream begins, most of the time, with a teacher who believes in you, who tugs and pushes and leads you on to the next plateau, sometimes poking you with a sharp stick called truth.
To poke a wood fire is more solid enjoyment than almost anything else in the world.
There's something that doesn't make sense. Let's go and poke it with a stick.
The pen is mightier than the sword, if you know where to poke it.
We can never be a nation of snobs so long as we are willing to poke fun at ourselves.
When moral superiority combines with billowing ignorance, they fill up a hot-air balloon that's awfully hard not to poke.
The only good imitations are those that poke fun at bad originals.
Research is formalized curiosity. It is poking and prying with a purpose.
In the land of the blind, the one-eyed man will poke out his eye to fit in.
Remember, people who peek through keyholes have to expect an occasional poke in the eye.
A stranger stabs you in the front. A friend stabs you in the back. A boyfriend stabs you in the heart. Best friends poke each other with straws.
In life there will always be people out the to judge you and poke fingers at you. Show them that we are all human and that the other three fingers are poking back at them.
